p.s: John Worne writes that it is a problem that many young people do not know more languages than englishEnglish.
But is language learning really vital for theUK's future prosperity and global standing?
on the one hand not everybody in the world speaks englishEnglish so it is better to know a second language.
On the other hand not everybody is able or has the skill to learn another language because it can be hard sometimes.
But if you can a second language it is possible and easier to study or work abroad and it is easier for workers and students to work/study in the UK.
So the UK can also get more multinational (-friendly).
It is true that a lot of people speak englishEnglish but not everybody.
So people who get the chance should learn an other language for people that do not have a chance to learn englishEnglish.
And when everybody sees that the number of students who learning an other language goes down, you know that that is a huge problem.
Humans are social species and they need to communicate and not just in englishEnglish.
The best part of learning new languages is that when you learned one it is way easier to learn more.
If you can speak frenchFrench it is also easy to understand portogesePortuguese, or spanishSpanish.
This is also a romanRoman language.
So what is stopping you from language learning?
In a nutshell language learning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing.
